ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But do not obey any vile swearer of oaths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Do not heed a contemptible swearer,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And do not yield to any contemptible swearer,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do not yield to one persistent in swearing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Nor ever listen to any excessive oath maker, ignoble person.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And do not obey every Hallaf Mahin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And yield not to any mean swearer
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And obey thou not every mean swearer,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Neither obey thou each feeble oath-monger,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Do not yield to any contemptible swearer of oaths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And obey not: thou any swearer ignominous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And do not obey any vile swearer,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Heed not the type of despicable men,- ready with oaths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And obey not everyone who swears much, and is considered worthless,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And do not obey every mean swearer,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And do not obey any vile swearer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:10] And do not obey any mean, despicable, oath-monger, given to frequent swearing by falsehood,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Neither obey thou) Muhammad (each feeble) with regard to the religion of Allah (oath monger) who lies against Allah. This refers to al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah al-Makhzumi,
